availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Henry Dobyns (Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p:
Garrard County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary E. Robinson
Dobyns in Garrard County on September 6, 1856. Father of Richard H. Dobyns. Farmer in Lancaster, Kentucky, in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in 1860. Served in the 12th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as adjutant. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as captain and assistant quartermaster from February 29, 1864, to June 7, 1864. Honorably mustered out on January 8, 1866.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, Lancaster, p. 701.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Garrard County, p. 21.

U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Kentucky.
